turkishSentence: Siz buraya gelirken, herhangi biri sizi takip ediyor muydu?
englishSentence: Was anybody following you while you were coming here?

turkishSentence: Siz vardığınızda, onlar işi yapıyor muydu?
englishSentence: Were they doing the work when you arrived?
They weren't holding up the traffic.
Nobody was following the instructions.
How were they dyeing the cloth?

turkishSentence: Alice paten yaparken, kendine zarar verdi.
englishSentence: Alice hurt herself while she was skating.

turkishSentence: Sally, Park St.'de bisikletine binerken, bir arkadaşını gördü.
englishSentence: Sally saw a friend while she was riding her bicycle along Park St.

turkishSentence: Bob, birlikte dans ederlerken, Jane'in ayaklarına bastı.
englishSentence: Bob stepped on Jane's feet while they were dancing together.

turkishSentence: Bay ve Bayan Brown kurabiye pişirirlerken, kendilerini yaktılar.
englishSentence: Mr. and Mrs. Brown burned themselves while they were baking cookies.

turkishSentence: Tommy bir arkadaşının evinde uyurken, bir kabus gördü.
englishSentence: Tommy had a nightmare while he was sleeping at a friend's house.

turkishSentence: Araba bana çarptığında, karşıdan karşya geçiyordum.
englishSentence: I was crossing the street when the car hit me.

turkishSentence: Babam, biz televizyon izlerken, gazete okuyordu.

turkishSentence: Kadın bulaşıkları yıkarken, adam odayı süpürüyordu.

englishSentence: I wasn't doing anything when the teacher came.

turkishSentence: Eve gelirken, eski bir arkadaşla karşılaştım.
englishSentence: As I was coming home, I met an old friend.

turkishSentence: Araba çocuğa çarptığında, yola bakıyor muydun?

turkishSentence: Postacı, tam ben evden çıkarken, geldi.
englishSentence: The postman came just as I was leaving home.

turkishSentence: Dün gece saat dokuzda bir kitap okuyordum.
